mobs.long_desc: Lokari, God of the Moonless Night, laughs uproariously at your daring!
mobs.desc: He is huge, far larger than any ordinary human, with translucent, pale skin and black hair with a slightly blue sheen.  He seems to glow from within with a silvery light, forming a nimbus around him, and his glittering, indigo eyes glint with amusement above a capricious grin.

mobs.long_desc: A young man in mage's robes looks up dully.
mobs.desc: This young-looking man's greyhound-lithe body is still clad in his mage's robes, and his long auburn hair still tumbles past the dark velvet, but he is clearly a denizen of the next world, not of this one any longer.  He is unearthly pale, with haunted blue eyes.  The animated corpse regards visitors without visible emotion, and when he moves, he is silent but nowhere near as graceful as he must have been in life.

mobs.long_desc: A red-headed woman in black leathers whirls on you!
mobs.desc: This short, lithe woman is still clad in her thief blacks, the leather conforming to every angle and curve of her body, and her auburn hair tumbles down her back, to be held back by a leather cord.  But she is an animated corpse, and not part of this world any more: She is pale, and clumsier than one might expect.  Her blue eyes are emotionless and haunted.

mobs.long_desc: A battle-hardened warrior in worn leathers seems to appear out of nowhere!
mobs.desc: The nomadic Jann are of all planes, and none of them.  Recognized as the only beings capable of traversing any plane, they enjoy free access to them all. Their ferocity in protecting their own is legendary, as is their manic strength, rooted in quiet, disciplined determination.  Though this Jann finds himself in Lokari's domain, it is a temporary situation--even now you see that he is wearing traveling leathers.  You cringe a little, knowing that in a fight, a Jann will not stop until he--or you--is dead.

mobs.long_desc: A woman in ranger's leathers moves toward you with deadly purpose.
mobs.desc: She is human, but taller than most men.  Her muscular, rangy form is misty and luminescent, and she herself is very pale, with grey eyes that look haunted and defeated.  She moves without sound, gliding wherever she needs to go, and when she strikes it is without warning.  But when she fights, it is with a resigned attitude.

mobs.long_desc: A mumbling old man notices your entrance with annoyance.
mobs.desc: He is an old man, ancient beyond all reckoning.  He grumbles to himself, moving very slowly in his velvet brocade robes.  But for all that, he seems strong, formidable, in fact.  The secrets of the stars themselves seem hidden in his mysteriously painted robes, in the golden medallions he wears.

mobs.long_desc: A Keep servant is busy in here tidying up.
mobs.desc: The man before you is of indeterminate age, dressed in fairly new castoffs-- a faded beige silk tunic with a small, obviously old stain in it worn over linen breeches, with leather slippers. He moves with purpose, as he probably has all the years of his servitude, straightening a painting here, tidying a bookshelf there, with hands that are callused from his years of labor. Most disturbing, though, are the servant's eyes, glowing with fanaticism.

mobs.long_desc: A Keep maidservant is busy in here tidying up.
mobs.desc: The woman before you is of indeterminate age, perhaps young, perhaps middle-aged.  Her dark hair is tied back neatly with a red silk scarf.  Her clothes might have been sufficient for court use, once; she wears a black and red linen dress whose lace decorations are now threadbare, with a white linen apron over both.  She moves with purpose, a feather duster in her hand, cleaning a room that already looks clean.

mobs.long_desc: You see something out of the corner of your eye.
mobs.desc: The shadows themselves seem to coalesce to give form and shape to the creature now facing you.  It has no corporeal form to injure.  It has no mouth with which to growl curses at you.  It looks more like a shadow on the wall.  But you do hear soft curses, words in another language, every once in a while, as if you surprised it unpleasantly.

mobs.long_desc: A golden woman coalesces from sunlight right before your eyes.
mobs.desc: Her form is beauty itself: smooth golden muscles, firm body, long golden hair, blazing amber eyes.  She looks as if someone cast her from gold itself; she even has a distinctly ethereal look about her, as if she could dissolve into the same sunbeam that gave her birth at any moment.

mobs.long_desc: A Jann warrior wearing an elaborate crown sits pensively in a throne.
mobs.desc: The crown on his head is made of gold, inset with gems, and it seems to suit him not at all.  He's a rough-and-tumble sort; you wish you could just sit and play cards with him.  And he's certainly the headstrong, stubborn, loyal, fierce type you'd want with you in a fight.  The burdens of leadership and responsibility rest on his shoulders like an uncomfortably heavy cloak that can't ever be removed.

mobs.long_desc: A beautiful blonde woman eyes you suspiciously.
mobs.desc: This woman is striking in appearance, with her light blonde, almost white hair, and her statuesque form.  Finely but not overly muscled, and arrogant, she seems like a ferocious opponent not because of her mere physical appearance, but because she seems so intelligent and fast-moving.  But as substantial as she is, her pale skin and haunted expression marks her as belonging to the next world, not to this one.  Her unearthly silence is never broken, and she makes not a sound as she stands guard.

mobs.long_desc: A despondent warrior looks up as you approach.
mobs.desc: You have to admit you were curious about just what the ancient hero, Severan, looked like.  You are suitably impressed.  He's of average height, more musclebound than you previously thought humanly possible, with his shoulder-length brown hair tied back with a leather thong.  But if this is Severan, he must be long dead--his epic battle with Lokari's forces was so long ago the date has faded into legend.  And now that you have realized that, you notice details that are out of whack: Severan's eyes are curiously devoid of emotion, and his movements aren't quite as dextrous as you'd think a warrior of his calibre's would be.

mobs.long_desc: A weeping lady stares at you in astonishment.
mobs.desc: You recognize this woman immediately as the Princess Irinia. A slender, petite figure, she moves slowly, as though ages of sorrow have dulled her movements. Her celebrated golden skin is paler now, because of her years of imprisonment, and her long, curly auburn hair is a little limp, but you can still see what first attracted the warrior Severan to her. Even though she is beautiful, you can also see character behind her attractive exterior. She is exactly the kind of woman who would stand beside her beloved even in the face of a god's demands, and probably the only woman in the world who could have endured a god's wrath for her refusal to abandon her principles. Lokari's punishment was cruel indeed. She endured, but she did not survive, and even her death did not free her. You realize with a sick start that Lokari warped her spirit into serving him after all.

mobs.long_desc: A maid in waiting glares at you with unreasoning hatred.
mobs.desc: Here you see a young-seeming woman dressed in what must have been a pretty, somewhat declasse dress, perhaps some castoff of her mistress'.  But she is obviously not fully human; her eyes mark her as a madwoman, as does her neglect of her body.  She is Lokari's creature now, kept alive unnaturally through the eons to aid him in protecting his dungeons.

mobs.long_desc: An ancient gardener kneels on the ground while he tends the plants.
mobs.desc: As you watch, plants bud, sprout, and bloom under this ancient man's very hands, as if he is somehow coaxing them to grow much faster than normal.  He seems very strong despite his years; perhaps the plants he helps to live help him to live in turn?  Perhaps this is one of that tribe of Gardener Mystics you heard of; if so, then Lokari must especially value their services to keep his gardens beautiful.

mobs.long_desc: A golden woman coalesces from sunlight right before your eyes.
mobs.desc: Her form is beauty itself: smooth golden muscles, firm body, long golden hair, blazing amber eyes.  She looks as if someone cast her from gold itself; she even has a distinctly ethereal look about her, as if she could dissolve into the same sunbeam that gave her birth at any moment.

mobs.long_desc: A golden woman coalesces from sunlight right before your eyes.
mobs.desc: Her form is beauty itself: smooth golden muscles, firm body, long golden hair, blazing amber eyes.  She looks as if someone cast her from gold itself; she even has a distinctly ethereal look about her, as if she could dissolve into the same sunbeam that gave her birth at any moment.

mobs.long_desc: You see something out of the corner of your eye.
mobs.desc: The shadows themselves seem to coalesce to give form and shape to the creature now facing you.  It has no corporeal form to injure.  It has no mouth with which to growl curses at you.  It looks more like a shadow on the wall.  But you do hear soft curses, words in another language, every once in a while, as if you surprised it unpleasantly.

mobs.long_desc: A handsome minstrel, singing and strumming a mandolin, wanders here.
mobs.desc: This young man is probably much older than he looks -- it would take YEARS to master the mandolin like he has.  Tall and thin, though well muscled, he wears clothes designed to conceal his body.  He has long, thin fingers, the better to play his instruments.

mobs.long_desc: A forlorn little maid in waiting cries in the darkness.
mobs.desc: This little maid seems very young, but the suffering in her posture and her face instantly mark her as undead.  Her untold years of agony are easiest to see in her delicate little face.  She's obviously in such a rage that she'll attack anything that moves!

mobs.long_desc: A maid in waiting glares at you with unreasoning hatred.
mobs.desc: Here you see a young-seeming woman dressed in what must have been a pretty, somewhat declasse dress, perhaps some castoff of her mistress'.  But she is obviously not fully human; her eyes mark her as a madwoman, as does her neglect of her body.  She is Lokari's creature now, kept alive unnaturally through the eons to aid him in protecting his dungeons.

mobs.long_desc: A maid in waiting glares at you with unreasoning hatred.
mobs.desc: Here you see a young-seeming woman dressed in what must have been a pretty, somewhat declasse dress, perhaps some castoff of her mistress'.  But she is obviously not fully human; her eyes mark her as a madwoman, as does her neglect of her body.  She is Lokari's creature now, kept alive unnaturally through the eons to aid him in protecting his dungeons.

objects.ground: A gem-encrusted staff lies on the ground here.

extras.text: The bronze staff in your hands is huge-- it's almost too large to hold effectively.  It pulses with power, its gemstone decorations lit as if from some inner radiance.  A crystal on its tip sparkles with light.  Your hands tingle at contact with it.  You wonder what it does.

objects.ground: A glittering steel blade lies here.

extras.text: Your hand aches to wield this fabulous sword. Made of pure white steel, glowing as if from some inner light, it pulses like the heart of legend itself. This is the sword of the ancient heroes out of your land's stories, the sword that destroyed armies almost of its own accord. This is the sword of the god Lokari. It's lavishly decorated: an ivy-leaf pattern along the blade. The quillons are short, but curved upward in a continuation of that pattern, making a very effective looking basket hilt. A huge onyx forms the pommel. You can detect in this amazing sword that touch of greatness that has made its name revered -- and feared -- by all great warriors.

objects.ground: A beautiful ruby wristlet lies here.

extras.text: You see a cuff made of large, rectangular-cut rubies pieced side by side to form the cuff itself.  A strong-looking clasp holds the cuff together.  The gemstones are of the highest quality-- pigeon's-blood-red, clear as crystal, with not a flaw present to the eye.  As you look closer, you can see that each gem is housed in a copper-colored setting.

objects.ground: A leather girdle lies here.

extras.text: You see a braided suede leather belt here. It's twice the length of your entire body. You've seen this type of belt before-- you're supposed to take it and wind it around your body twice, loop it in a specific way, and let the ends fall to your calves. It seems like it'd hamper your movement, if you did that, but perhaps it will benefit you to the point that you don't mind it doing that.

objects.ground: A pair of red gloves lies folded on the ground here.

extras.text: Just looking at these gloves makes your hands itch with excitement.  They're made of a leather even thinner than kid leather in a dashing red colour.  They flare almost to the elbow.  You can tell that even wearing these exquisite gloves, you would still retain your ability to feel whatever you touch.

objects.ground: Some unfortunate soul has dropped a thin cloak here.

extras.text: You behold a cloak made of some kind of thin, blood-red damasked silk embroidered over with dark blue silk thread in cunning designs.  The collar is lined in thick, deep brown fur.  You get the uncanny feeling that this flowing cloak isn't quite what it seems.  It seems to have a sense of power to it. Some sense of intuition you didn't even know you had tells you to handle this cloak carefully.

objects.ground: A green vest lies folded here.

extras.text: This is the Cailaran Vest, which you've heard of in stories, seen in tapestries and paintings, even idly imagined seeking (and finding).  It's a long green vest, belted around the waist with a bronze clasp, and flowing to the calves. The grass-green silk is lightly embroidered in golden thread in a criss-cross pattern.  The double-breasted collar is embroidered as well, in golden four-pointed stars.  It'd look perfect with a silk blouse and breeches.

objects.ground: A blue-steel sword glints in the darkness here.

extras.text: Here you see Rahmat, the ancient sword used by the High Paladin of the Order of the Sun. Its blue steel blade gleams as though it were brand new, not older than the mountains, its edge sharp as Truth. Its hilt is a silvery metal, with claw quillions. A brilliant green emerald forms its pommel. You sense that only someone truly Good, and truly strong, could wield this weapon.

objects.ground: A staff of the Sunchildren sits here.
A tiny shape dangles in the darkness.

extras.text: Shadows coalesce into a tiny sliver roughly the shape and size of a small viper fang.  Wisps of darkness tumble off the ethereal shape like smoke before evaporating.

objects.ground: A long needle glints on the floor here.

extras.text: This is a very sharp, very shiny, and very long needle! As you examine it, you accidentally poke yourself. A crimson drop of blood wells out of your fingertip. As you suck your finger, you do notice that its eye doesn't look very large, for its size.

objects.ground: A pentagram-shaped locket lies here, forgotten.

extras.text: You see a small pendant on a chain. Further investigation reveals that the pendant is actually a locket, inscribed with a pentagram. The delicate golden chain seems barely strong enough to support the meager weight of the locket. You cannot pry the locket open, though. You wonder why. It's pretty old. Perhaps it's just stuck closed. Whatever the reason, you take an instant dislike to the locket. You're quite sure it's going to be nothing but bad news.

objects.ground: A glass shard glints with the fire of the sun.

extras.text: You behold a beautiful glass shard, about the length of your forearm. It resembles a stalactite in that it is pyramidal in shape, with a nearly flat base, narrowing to a wickedly pointed tip.

objects.ground: A chest made of glass rests here.

extras.text: The chest is made of what seems to be dozens of large shards of crystal or glass. You can't tell how the shards fit together, but the effect makes the chest seem like it's made of melting ice. The golden hinges, and a golden clasp, hold a lid made of more shards tightly closed. You think you can see something through the shards, though you can't tell what it is because of the distortion of the shards. There doesn't seem to be any way to get into the chest. The clasp is not locked, but it's held closed by a glass shard that's gotten loose somehow.

objects.ground: Brilliant sunshine pours out from a golden votive lamp on the ground.

extras.text: This votive lamp seems simple enough, a golden representation of flame.  One of the greatest sorceresses in the world, Phayla, gives them to those wizards who derive power from her mysteries -- for the right price.

objects.short: the Holy Moon Symbol of Lokari
objects.ground: A silver crescent moon charm shines on the ground.

extras.text: This little silver charm is the God of the Moonless Night's gift to his clerics, to keep them safe and identify them as Lokari's to anyone who might inquire as to their status.  It's just a silver crescent-moon shape.

objects.ground: A dark-beaded necklace lies hidden in shadows.

extras.text: It's a fairly simple necklace -- teak beads carved into geometric shapes are strung onto dark thread to form a circle of beads.  Here and there little strings of beads are strung along the main circlet to form interesting geometric designs.  This necklace is a charm from the Wizardess Thekra; you recognize it at once.

objects.ground: A beautifully carved sword case hangs on the wall.

extras.text: And now... The end of the quest. Here you see the goal you have fought for, and won. Dare you open it, to claim the prize within? Ah, but the carved and scrollworked swordcase is locked? You lean in to look closer, but see only crayon marks at the bottom of the wooden case -- marks that make no sense to you. Perhaps some wizard laid a curse upon it, so it would open only with a key of the caster's choosing...
The marks make no sense at all, unfortunately -- just red waxy scrawls.

objects.ground: A thick woolen tabard lies folded carefully.

extras.text: Thick and woolen, this quilted garment seems like it would keep you very well protected.  It's quite ancient, obviously, though still servicable.  To your modern eyes, the embroidery on it seems distinctly unwarriorish, but in its day, it must have been an extraordinary garment.

The needlepointed designs depict fantastic birds and animals amid twining branches and leaves. It must have taken forever to do it all. In the corner of the tabard, needlepointed words read: I am my beloved's And my beloved is mine.

objects.ground: Some noble lady has lost her handkerchief.

extras.text: It's a very simple white silk handkerchief with daintily turned edges hemstitched neatly.  An initial is embroidered in silver thread in one corner: "I".

objects.ground: A little wax crayon lies amid treasures.

extras.text: It's just a little red wax crayon with no wrapper. It smells pretty tantalizing...

objects.ground: An oblong black case is propped up against the wall.

extras.text: A case of hard, oiled black leather provides a safe, waterproof environment for the precious instruments carried within.  A crescent moon has been worked into the leather casing and dyed a bright silver color, marking the case as originating from the stores of Lokari himself.  Shaped rather like a pear, it looks like it was made to contain some kind of stringed instrument with a short neck.  A black strap embroidered with patterns of stars attaches to either end of the case, and it looks like it could be comfortably worn slung over a shoulder.

objects.ground: A wooden instrument with a teardrop-shaped body has been abandoned here.

extras.text: The mandolin is fairly light for its size, made of a thin yet durable walnut wood and skillfully stained in patterns of six-pointed flowers on the teardrop-shaped sounding board.  The neck is also stained dark, and the tuning pegs are made of a fine silver that doesn't seem to tarnish with use.  The strings are paired in four groups, for a total of eight, giving it a characteristic way of being plucked to form chords.  Its deep body makes for a full sound, and its tone is quite pleasant to listen to.

objects.ground: A tiny dagger mounted on a leather bracelet lies here.

extras.text: Mounted on a sturdy leather bracelet, a small leather sleeve hides a silver-hued dagger that can be flipped out with a skilled flick of the wrist. The bracelet is secured on the wrist by several thin leather straps.  The dagger is a little longer than a human hand, reaching just far enough from the wrist to do some serious damage.

objects.ground: A Jann warrior's scroll lies here.
objects.action_desc: $n lets out a huge thunderous roar! ROARRRRRRRRRRRRR!

objects.ground: The Jann Lord's scroll lies here.
A ruby-studded key lies here.

extras.text: You see an old key, its metal dark with age. But you can barely see the metal for the beautiful blood-red rubies encrusting the key.

objects.ground: A patch of blackness lies on the floor here.

extras.text: What's this? Your eyes widen as you see that what you had originally taken as a patch of blackness actually has a distinct form-- that of a key, a traditionally formed one at that. Where the key comes into contact with its surroundings, it seems to blur at the edges.

objects.ground: A pickaxe has been abandoned here.

extras.text: An involuntary grin crosses your features as you judge the superior heft and balance of this mining tool. Its head is made of battered steel; its long handle is of some hardwood you've never seen before, wound with leather thongs. Though it is clearly intended to be a mere workman's tool, its high quality makes you wonder how well it would function as a weapon.

objects.ground: A guard must have dropped his key here.

extras.text: The key is starkly utilitarian, obviously intended to fulfill some purpose and that is all.

objects.ground: A thorned metal key lies here.

extras.text: At first you think it's made of wood, since the thorns look so lifelike, but then you change your mind. It's made of ancient bronze, you decide.

objects.ground: A small iron hammer lies on the ground here.

extras.text: If you had any background in woodworking, you'd instantly recognize this small hammer as a ballpeen hammer.  Its head is made of metal, almost bullet-shaped on one side.  The handle is made of exquisite blonde wood.  It looks delicate enough to be usable on fine jewelry.  You do notice that one of its two sides narrows to a point.

objects.ground: A crystalline rod, chased with gold, lies here.

extras.text: The Jann have no need of this rod. They can go between Planes with a mere thought, with a mere wish. But they know that sometimes they require others to be able to as well. And this Rod gives non-Jann the ability to access the Altar of Sending -- somehow. The Rod itself is rather plain, being ancient yarrow wood stained auburn, and subtly carved with flowing ivy vine shapes. The head of the staff is slightly bulbous and rounded gently. The entire staff is just about as tall as you are. It's completely smooth. It feels completely natural to hold it in your hand.

triggers.name: doom_minstrel_play
triggers.commands: if %self.wearing[48924]% remove instrument-case open instrument-case get mandolin instrument-case hold mandolin sit wait 2s mecho %self.name% begins to play a mandolin softly. wait 2s mecho The music builds into a swelling crescendo. masound Beautiful music floats in from somewhere nearby. wait 4s mecho The music begins to fade as %self.name% wraps up the piece. masound The music fades away. wait 2s mecho %self.name% stops playing. stand bow wait 2s put mandolin instrument-case close instrument-case wear instrument-case end
